      "source": [
        "# Molecular Docking Score Simulator\n",
        "\n",
        "This notebook simulates docking scores of ligands to a target molecule.\n",
        "You can change ligand names and see their scores interactively."
      ]
    },

      "source": [
        "\n",
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "import ipywidgets as widgets\n",
        "from IPython.display import display\n",
        "\n",
        "# Default ligands\n",
        "ligands = {\n",
        "    \"Ligand A\": 0.8,\n",
        "    \"Ligand B\": 0.6,\n",
        "    \"Ligand C\": 0.9\n",
        "}\n",
        "\n",
        "def show_scores(lig1_score=0.8, lig2_score=0.6, lig3_score=0.9):\n",
        "    scores = [lig1_score, lig2_score, lig3_score]\n",
        "    names = [\"Ligand A\", \"Ligand B\", \"Ligand C\"]\n",
        "\n",
        "    # Display scores\n",
        "    print(\"Ligand Docking Scores:\")\n",
        "    for n, s in zip(names, scores):\n",
        "        print(f\"{n}: {s:.2f}\")\n",
        "\n",
        "    # Plot bar chart\n",
        "    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
        "    plt.figure(figsize=(6,4))\n",
        "    plt.bar(names, scores, color='green')\n",
        "    plt.ylabel(\"Docking Score\")\n",
        "    plt.title(\"Molecular Docking Score Simulation\")\n",
        "    plt.ylim(0, 1)\n",
        "    plt.show()\n",
        "\n",
        "widgets.interact(\n",
        "    show_scores,\n",
        "    lig1_score=widgets.FloatSlider(value=0.8, min=0, max=1, step=0.01),\n",
        "    lig2_score=widgets.FloatSlider(value=0.6, min=0, max=1, step=0.01),\n",
        "    lig3_score=widgets.FloatSlider(value=0.9, min=0, max=1, step=0.01)\n",
        ")"
      ]
    }
  ],
